author: protoplanetary
content:
Per <@602753420033785856>'s question in <#892088344438255616> about whether to add a flag to CL clients to temporarily censor slashings to help Holesky finalize, my (a solo staker's) take is that it's a pandora's box.

If that flag is added to clients, and if this situation were ever to occur on mainnet, I think there would be a huge amount of pressure from everyone staking on the "wrong" side of the fork to a) activate this flag (so they don't get slashed rejoining the correct fork), and b) to either leave it active indefinitely, or to implement some kind of corollary "amnesty" logic  to guarantee that they wouldn't be punished for their clients having bugs.

There might actually be some value in thinking more about what such a socially-activated "amnesty" might look like, in the case of a supermajority bug like this, but IMO including a way to deactivate slashing on CLs should only be done if we have already thought through the mainnet game theory carefully. Once it's implemented in clients it will likely be hard to go back to how things were before, where slashing was just assumed to be unavoidable in cases like this.

author: yokem55
content: As good as it is to work out the technical side of a recovery like this, on mainnet there's going to be a huge amount of pressure to find some way to avoid slashing 2/3+ of the stake. As is, recovering holesky depends on the majority being willing to get back on the minority fork, and propose enough blocks so that their own slashings can be processed and get the chain back to finality. That won't happen willingly on mainnet.
